lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Orca.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Orca.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
Welcome to Orca, your friendly task management assistant! Orca helps you keep track of your todos, deadlines, and events with a simple command-line interface.
1. ‚úì Ensure you have Java installed on your computer
2. ‚¨áÔ∏è Download the latest version of Orca
4. üéâ Start managing your tasks with simple commands!
Shows all your tasks in a numbered list.
Add a simple task without any deadline.
Add a task with a specific deadline.
Add a task with a start and end time.
Mark a task as completed using its number.
Awesome! Congrats on finishing this task!
Change a completed task back to not done.
Okay, I have unmarked this task!
Remove a task from your list using its number.
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Search for tasks containing specific keywords.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Display all available commands and their usage.
list                            - Display all tasks in your list.
mark <task number>              - Mark a task as done.
unmark <task number>            - Mark a task as not done.
todo <description>              - Add a new todo task.
deadline <description> /by <time>  - Add a new deadline task.
event <description> /from <start time> /to <end time> - Add a new event task.
find <keyword>                  - Find tasks matching the keyword.
Save your tasks and exit the application.
Bye! Hope to see you again soon :)
Orca automatically saves your tasks after every change you make. Here's what you need to know about data management:
- Tasks are saved in the `data/tasks.txt` file
- The `data` folder is created automatically in the same directory as the application
- Every change (add, mark, unmark, delete) is saved immediately
Each task type is saved with a specific format:
If the data file is corrupted, Orca will:
- üì¢ Show warning messages for corrupted data
| `UPPER_CASE` | Parameter to be supplied by you |
- In `todo DESCRIPTION`, replace `DESCRIPTION` with your task
| ‚è∞ Deadline | `deadline DESCRIPTION /by TIME`                   | `deadline submit report /by Monday 2pm` |
| üìÖ Event    | `event DESCRIPTION /from START_TIME /to END_TIME` | `event team meeting /from 3pm /to 5pm`  |
Here are some common error messages and how to fix them:
- ‚úÖ Include a description after the command
- Example: `todo read book` instead of just `todo`
- ‚úÖ Include the task number for mark/unmark/delete commands
- ‚úÖ The task number provided doesn't exist
- Use `list` to see valid task numbers
- ‚úÖ Use the correct format: `deadline DESCRIPTION /by TIME`
- ‚úÖ Use the correct format: `event DESCRIPTION /from START_TIME /to END_TIME`
**Q: What happens if I close the program without using `bye`?**
- ‚úÖ Your tasks are saved automatically after every change, so no data will be lost.
**Q: Can I edit a task after creating it?**
- üîÑ Currently, you need to delete the task and create a new one with the correct information.
**Q: Is there a limit to how many tasks I can add?**
- ‚úÖ No, you can add as many tasks as you need.
**Q: Can I move my tasks to another computer?**
- ‚úÖ Yes, just copy the `data/tasks.txt` file to the same location on the new computer.
**Q: Can I use the same task description multiple times?**
- ‚úÖ Yes, you can have multiple tasks with the same description.
**Q: How do I change a todo to a deadline or event?**
- üîÑ Delete the todo task and create a new deadline or event task with the same description.

* Handles persistent storage of tasks to and from disk.

* OS-independent way and includes error handling for file operations.

* Represents a task with a deadline.
* A deadline task has a description and a specific time/date by which it needs to be completed.
* @param description The full command string in the format: "deadline <description> /by <time>"
* Gets the deadline date/time of this task.
* @return The deadline date/time as a string.
* Sets the deadline date/time for this task.
* An event task has a description and a specific time period (from start time to end time).
* @param input The full command string in the format: "event <description> /from <start time> /to <end time>"
* Gets the start time of the event.
* @return The start time as a string.
* Gets the end time of the event.
* @return The end time as a string.
